intro: Achoriphragma stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed achoriphragma, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator of ecological health.
